name: Rajendra V. Boppana
content: Home Page of RV Boppana Rajendra V. Boppana Teaching Interests Experience Computer Architecture, Parallel Processing, Computer Networks, and Performance Evaluation. Research Interests (detailed statement) Publications Current Projects Currently interested in wireless and sensor networks secure routing and intrusion detection techniques metro-area hybrid wireless networks multicasts and other collective communication techniques autonomic computing and communications Worked in the area of parallel processing. More specifically on data access and alignment techniques for parallel memories self-routing algorithms for multistage interconnection networks and hypercubes adaptive, multicast, and fault-tolerant wormhole routing algorithms for parallel computers Some of my publications are in the most cited list for routing, compiled by CiteSeer. Research Projects Grants Experimental Research in High-Performance Computing and Wireless Networking, NSF Research and Development of Protocols and Applications for Sensor Networks, Signal Technology Corp., Dallas, Texas. Other Activities Program Committee member: CCNC 2007, PDCS 2007, Globecom 2007. Vice General Co-Chair, HiPC 2007. Guest Co-editor, IEEE Systems Journal, Special Issue on RFID Systems, First Quarter of 2008. Rajendra V.
